resourceName: HEK293 NF1 -/- Exon 17 #B48 G629R cryptic splice
observationText: The HEK293 NF1 -/- Exon 17 #B48 G629R cryptic splice cell line was generated via CRISPR-Cas9 gene editing to introduce the c.1885G>A mutation in the NF1 gene, creating a cryptic splice acceptor site and frameshift in exon 17 that likely undergoes nonsense-mediated decay. Multiple clones including B48 were isolated and characterized.

resourceName: HEK293 NF1 -/- Exon 17 #B48 G629R cryptic splice
observationText: In the HEK293 NF1 -/- Exon 17 #B48 G629R cryptic splice cell line containing only the mutant exon 17, antisense oligonucleotides were able to skip the mutant exon and restore neurofibromin protein expression to within 40% of wild-type levels. The restored protein was functional and able to reduce pERK/ERK ratios.

resourceName: HEK293 NF1 -/- Exon 17 #B48 G629R cryptic splice
observationText: The HEK293 NF1 -/- Exon 17 #B48 G629R cryptic splice cell line contained varying ratios of wild-type and mutant NF1 alleles across different subclones.

resourceName: HEK293 NF1 -/- Exon 17 #B48 G629R cryptic splice
observationText: Antisense oligonucleotides were designed to target exonic splice enhancer motifs and pre-mRNA secondary structures in exon 17 and flanking introns of the NF1 gene in the HEK293 NF1 -/- Exon 17 #B48 G629R cryptic splice cell line.
